content.title: Bio Control Laboratory and Pesticides Testing Laboratory Scheme
content.details: The “Bio Control Laboratory and Pesticides Testing Laboratory Scheme” is a State Plan Scheme, which is implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The objective of the scheme is the production of Bio Control Agents such as Trichoderma, Trichogramma, etc., and further distribution to farmers as awareness and demonstration for organic Plant Health Management in order to promote organic crop production.
benefits: Distributions of bio agents to farmers.
Free distribution to popularise the method.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
content.application_process: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper. Along with the application, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the relevant documents at the nearest office of the Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Agriculture Circle. The bonafide farmers having sufficient available cultivable land shall be selected on a first come first served basis.
documents_required: Documents proof of having sufficient available cultivable land

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The key objective is the production of Bio Control Agents such as Trichoderma, Trichogramma, etc. and further distribution to farmers as awareness and demonstration for organic Plant Health Management in order to promote organic crop production.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/entitlement?
faqs.answer: Free distribution of Bio Control Agents produced in the laboratory for popularizing their use in plant health management among farmers.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers having cultivable land and engage in agriculture can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bona fide farmers can apply in plain paper to the District Agriculture Officer of the concerned Districts through the Agriculture Development officer of C & RD Block/ Agriculture Circle/Sub-Divisional Agricultural Officers of the concerned Sub-Divisions.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries are selected based on first come first serve basis subject to availability of materials.
